item.title: Find Labs - Pioneering the Future of Web 3 with Purposeful Innovation
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Over the past year, the team at .find has experienced consistent growth. Our commitment to innovation, coupled with successful product launches and collaborations with esteemed teams, has propelled us to expand our horizons. As a result, we are thrilled to announce our rebranding from .find to Find Labs. In this article, we will highlight our journey and outline our vision as we forge ahead in the dynamic realm of Web 3.

Introduction:

The genesis of the .find team can be traced back to two visionary individuals who crossed paths during the crypto craze of 2021. Drawing from their extensive backrounds and driven by their desire to innovate, Bjarte and Christian joined forces to establish .find, a groundbreaking wallet naming service on the Flow Blockchain. However, this was merely the starting point of our extraordinary voyage.

With a dedication to innovation and a mission to provide functional tools for the Flow blockchain ecosystem, we have spent close to two years building and developing projects that improve the lives of users utilizing Flow blockchain. Today, we stand proud, as a significant transformation occurs as .find transitions to Find Labs, signifying our commitment to constant evolution and progress.

.find — Flow’s Wallet Naming Platform:

In the early days of Flow Blockchain, as projects and services proliferated, a sense of fragmentation permeated the ecosystem. There was a pressing need for a comprehensive solution that would unify and streamline the management of digital assets. In response, find.xyz emerged as a pioneering platform, resolving these challenges by allowing users to link multiple wallets to a single .find name and quickly locate all their assets in one place.

Our team united under a shared purpose: to empower individuals to effortlessly locate what they seek within the Flow ecosystem. Through determination and ingenuity, we crafted a platform that revolutionized the user experience and fostered a sense of cohesion within the blockchain landscape. This project is near and dear to our hearts, and will be built upon in the years to come.

Some of our notable Collaborations:

Over the past two years, we have also forged invaluable collaborations and partnerships with esteemed teams such as Doodles and OneFootball. These partnerships have not only enriched our journey but have also enabled us to deliver exceptional solutions and bring our clients’ visions to life in Web 3. We look forward to future collaborations, working hand in hand with diverse clients to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of decentralized technologies.

A Vision for the Future:

As Find Labs, our vision is clear: to be at the forefront of the Web 3 revolution by crafting innovative solutions that empower users, developers, and enterprises within the decentralized realm. Building upon our expertise in wallet naming services, we are committed to expanding our product offerings and delivering an array of tools and services that enhance the Flow blockchain experience. Our next big project, is an extensive block explorer, get ready to deep dive #onFlow.

Conclusion:

The rebranding from .find to Find Labs marks an extraordinary juncture in our trajectory, underscoring our relentless pursuit of innovation and growth. From our humble origins as a wallet naming service, we have embraced a broader vision that encompasses pioneering ventures such as our latest project, a block explorer specific for Flow blockchain. We extend our deepest gratitude to our community, partners, and supporters, who have been instrumental in our journey thus far.

Welcome to Find Labs, where we embark on a journey fueled by purposeful innovation. Join us as we shape the future of Web 3, empower individuals, and redefine the possibilities of decentralized technologies. Together, let us forge a path towards a more connected, inclusive, and transformative digital landscape.

The best is yet to come.

Helpful Links:

Hompage: https://www.findlabs.io/
.find Website: https://find.xyz
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Doodles

Website: https://doodles.app/

item.title: Afterfuture — Artist Spotlight — New Drop coming soon! #onFlow
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Afterfuture — Artist Spotlight — New Drop coming soon! #onFlow

With Afterfuture dropping their next big art release on the Flow Blockchain, we at .find wanted to get the inside scoop for collectors before the release. Enjoy this Q&A from the Afterfuture team.

To kick things off, can you tell us a bit about yourself and your background as an artist?
My name is Angel, and I’m the co-founder of Afterfuture. I started back in 2016 creating 3D stuff just for fun and saw the boom on Instagram that was happening back then, so I jumped on the wagon and started creating pieces every single day from early 2017 to late 2018.

What inspired you to create an NFT collection?
Specifically for Generated Experiences, it was a random idea that I thought sounded cool, like having an actual research facility named GENXP and the researchers simulating different artifacts in a strange old-looking machine that is futuristic at the same time.

How did you approach the creative process for this particular collection?
I started with the trailer first, which took quite some time to finish, and then the video loops, which is kind of weird, but I thought that’d speed up my process and making the still artworks would be the easier part, which definitely helped me a lot in the process. I started thinking about the rarities as well as the direction we’re going in because the story was pretty rough at the time.

(Currently, this platform doesn’t support .mov files, so be sure to check out on social media)

Can you walk us through some of the themes and motifs that are present in your NFT artwork?
We love creating pieces that are linked to nature and technology, working hand in hand. It’s always been our idea to create this harmony between those 2 completely different realities yet they’re in sync.

How do you see the intersection of art and technology evolving in the future?
Can’t say much about that because art and technology are evolving every single day, softwares are getting some incredible quality of life updates, technology is improving like no tomorrow, so it’s pretty easy to start creating art today.

What advice would you give to other artists who are interested in creating NFTs?
Just go for it, it never hurts to try out another space the same way we did, we came back in late 2020 and ended up loving it. Build slowly, interact with the community you’re going to be part of, reward the people supporting you, and things will happen.

Can you tell us about any upcoming projects or collaborations that you’re excited about?
I haven’t been around that much lately because of the amount of work we’ve been doing for Generated Experiences and other projects, but the 2 projects that I’m always excited to see expand are .find and Flovatar.

How do you think NFTs will impact the art world in the long term?
I think that NFTs have impacted the art world like no other wave before that, giving artists their freedom, the blockchain footprint of their work and royalties. I think it will help artists in the future to expand their brand, vision and maybe try some new ventures.

Finally, where can collectors go to view and purchase your NFT collection on our marketplace?
We’ve been on Flow for quite some time at this point, so collectors can explore our pieces and their stories at Versus, Starly, xtingles and very soon .find.

There you have it, some insight into the creators of the Generated Experiences collection, dropping on .find this Friday, 12-May! These are artists who have promoted and build #onFlow since the beginning.

You can .find more details on the official drop page here: https://find.xyz/afterfuture/pack/1

Helpful Links:

.find:

Website: https://find.xyz
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Afterfuture:

Drop Page: https://find.xyz/afterfuture/pack/1
Twitter: https://twitter.com/afterfuture_nft

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: How to send Doodles 2 Wearables to Non-Custodial Wallets: A Guide by .find
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
How to send Doodles 2 Wearables to Non-Custodial Wallets: A Guide by .find

Looking for a hassle-free way to move your Doodles 2 Wearables to a non-Custodial wallet? This blog post is for you.

Overview:

If you’re looking for a hassle-free way to move your Doodles 2 Wearables to non-Dapper wallets, you’ve come to the right place. The .find team have created a feature to move your wearables between ALL wallets, both custodial and non-custodial. Follow these steps to move your Wearables quickly and easily:

Follow the steps below to move your wearables from Dapper to non-Dapper wallets quickly and easily.

Condensed version of steps:

  1. Create a non-Dapper wallet
  2. Setup your .find profile
  3. Utilize .find’s send feature
  4. That’s it.

For more details, keep reading.

1. Create Non-Dapper Wallet:

If you don’t have a non-Dapper wallet yet, choose one that best suits your needs from options such as NuFi, Lilico, Flipper, or Blocto. Once you’ve created your wallet, you will need to activate the wearables collection to receive Wearables on the Flow Blockchain.

There are a handful of options to choose from and each have their merits: NuFi, Lilico, Flipper, & Blocto (& possibly others by the time you read this).

Step 2: Setup your .find profile

Navigate to the .find website and activate the wearables contract. After logging in with your non-Dapper wallet, set up your new account and click “Train Me” on your dashboard to prepare your wallet to receive Wearables. Be sure to have $Flow in your wallet to cover the gas fees for these transactions.

If this is your first time logging in with a new wallet, you will be guided through a streamlined profile activation phase. This does incur a small gas fee, so be sure to have some $Flow in your wallet.

Your wallet is now ready to receive Wearables!

Step 3: Login with your Dapper Wallet

Log in with your Dapper wallet and navigate to the NFT Detail Page under the COLLECTIONS tab on your dashboard. Select the Wearable you wish to move, click “SEND,” enter your address or .find name, and confirm the transaction.

Note: Sending Wearables via the .find platform is simple and easy. Attempting to send them through Dapper wallet UI will prompt additional steps.

Ready to Go!

That’s it! Your Doodles 2 Wearables will be transferred from your Dapper wallet to the non-Dapper wallet address you specified. Be sure to double-check the destination address before confirming the transfer to avoid any mistakes. You can use .find names to simplify the address and make it more human-readable. If you have any further questions, please feel free to reach out to us through our Discord or social media channels. Happy transacting!

Using .find names can be advantageous as they offer an easy-to-remember name for complex 0x… addresses. Moreover, .find names work seamlessly on various platforms within the Flow Ecosystem, making the transfer process even more streamlined as well as sharing your collection with friends.

We hope you enjoyed this short informative posts, if you have further questions feel free to reach out to us in our Discord or on social media, links below.

Have a Doodley day!

Some Common Issues:

  • Not having enough Flow — While transaction are really cheap #onFlow, you will need some Flow to setup your accounts. Additionally, Flow wallets can run out of storage if they don’t contain enough Flow tokens. So consider seeding your new wallet with at least 5 Flow to never worry again!
  • Not actuating first — If you try and send the wearables to your non-dapper wallet, before actuating the Wearables contract, the transaction will fail!
  • Using Dapper UI — if you try sending wearables via the Dapper UI, instead of using the .find platform, you might run into additional steps that could slow down the process.
Consider storing 5 Flow in your wallet to never worry about transaction fees or storage issues.

Helpful Links:

.find:

Website: https://find.xyz
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Doodles

Website: https://doodles.app/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/doodles

Author:

item.title: The Doodles .find their Flow
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
The Doodles .find their Flow

The Doodles team has launched Doodles 2 on the Flow Blockchain, which is rather exciting for current and future Flow enthusiasts! Here, we discuss Find’s role in assisting with this expansion from Ethereum to Flow, take a closer look at what we do, and examine some of the awesome new features we are implementing.

Overview

Creativity and innovation are key players in the world of NFTs. One specific project has been making waves in the industry, Doodles. Known for its unique approach to NFTs, Doodles are now taking a big step, in the right direction, by expanding onto the Flow blockchain with Doodles 2.

Excitingly, the backend expansion of Doodles 2 is being handled by us here at .find.

Going with the Flow 🌊

While Ethereum was an excellent theatre for stage one, the Doodles team had found themselves constrained by challenges such as network congestion, high gas prices and complex onboarding experience.

The wizards at Doodles, who are constantly seeking to expand their creative and technological cauldrons, needed the space and freedom to do so. They selected the Flow blockchain for their expansion to Doodles 2 because of the interoperability of Flow across various platforms, including social media, events, gaming, and streaming. Working with .find has enabled Doodles to build a robust architecture on Flow that will scale on demand. The Doodles community, and those new to the fun, can look forward to easy onboarding, frictionless interactions and checkout experiences when exploring the delights of Doodles 2.

Security — Users will also enjoy the enhanced safety and security benefits of Cadence, Flow’s unique resource-oriented programming language.

.find out what we built for Doodles

If you, like us, relish in a little more detail, here are the highlights of what .find actually built for Doodles:

  • Core Flow contracts. We have been working with Doodles and their partners to create, test, and refine their NFT, admin and wearables contracts. To achieve this we used the new default implementation in interfaces feature in Flow to create some really nice new patterns in Cadence, which in turn offered new and bespoke functions within the Doodles contracts.
  • Trusted Ethereum to Flow bridge — the Dooplicator As the name suggests, the Dooplicator we built is a verified trusted bridge to securely and seamlessly Dooplicate the Doodles from Ethereum to Flow. Owners will be able to create and link a Flow account to their Ethereum wallet, where they hold their Doodle or have purchased the rights to Dooplicate a Doodle and receive an airdrop of their Doodle 2 and wearables.
  • .find Doodles Marketplace. We couldn’t pass up the opportunity to create a wonderful marketplace to buy and sell all your Doodles 2 assets on Flow. So we have created a Doodles themed marketplace with Dapper wallet and .find name integration especially for your enjoyment.

Check it out here: https://find.xyz/mp/Wearables

Why you should .find us

  1. We build kick-ass software!
  2. We work fast and efficiently
  3. We’re awesome to work with (ask around!)

We at .find don’t just have epic pun skills, we have deep roots at the heart of the Flow community. Self-funded, and voraciously driven, we are working independently to support and advise Flow and projects working on Flow, while also building infrastructure and products to expand the ecosystem.

Recent work at .find:

  • Worked on the official NFT metadata standard for Flow
  • Created the .find name system for human readable domains on Flow
  • Built a fully featured marketplace for NFTs and .find names
  • Built the Aera Onefootball backend architecture
  • Built the Doodles 2 backend architecture
  • Integrated with both Dapper and non-Dapper wallets (Blocto, Lilico, etc.)

New features for .find

With the Doodles expansion, we took it upon ourselves to release some exciting new features.

  • We have just integrated buy/sell and link .find names with Dapper Wallet
  • You can now buy and sell NFTs with Dapper wallet
  • You can link multiple wallets to your find profile, both Dapper and Non-Dapper (Blocto, Lilico, etc.)
  • Buy and sell in both USD and FLOW

This is a great step forward to have integration for both Dapper and non-Dapper wallets, in turn we will only show the NFTs relevant to your logged in wallet.

  • Our Launchpad is now ready, you can apply here to launch your project on .find
  • NFT indexer, created to catch the current status and historical movements of all NFTs on Flow

.find out what’s in our pipeline

  • We have a completely redesigned marketplace — coming soon.
  • We have been building the tooling required to unify Flow NFT projects into a single unified marketplace across the various wallet types, much has been done but there is more to come.
  • On-chain blog posts and messaging
  • Floor sweep / bull buy features
  • We continue to enable companies and projects to innovate.
If you would like to work with us reach out through the channels below

Links and Resources:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all links below).

.find:

Website: https://find.xyz
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Roadmap: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Doodles

Website: https://doodles.app/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/doodles

Authors:

Luke Gerbil: https://twitter.com/LukeGerbil
Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

Resources:

Announcement: Announcing Doodles 2 is coming to Flow

https://flow.com/post/flow-blockchain-cadence-programming-language-resources-assets

item.title: Extending a .find Name
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Extending a .find Name

This is a short informative article for .find users searching for a descriptive guide on extending their .find Names on our platform.

Overview

.find names are leased out on a yearly basis, meaning, for a small yearly fee users get access to domains adding real world value to their wallet addresses. Since we opened last year, our platform has grown at an impressive rate, adding more capabilities and features, and the first names have begun to expire.

Users have 3-months to renew their names, after the three months, the names will be released to the public allowing other users to claim them.

No fret though, extending your favorite .find names is an easy process and will be explained here!

Step by Step:

Step 1 - Login with Blocto:

First is self-explanatory, navigate to the .find website and login with your Blocto wallet, soon users will also be able to create a profile using their Dapper Wallet (Exciting!) but for now utilise Blocto.

Step 2 — Navigate to your Dashboard

The user Dashboard hosts a lot of helpful information, so feel free to spend some time in this area to see all the helpful features .find has to offer!

Desktop: This is found on the left hand side — when you hover your mouse over the left panel, it will pop-out and you can then click (Dashboard).

Mobile: After logging in, you might find yourself already on the dashboard page, if not, click the hamburger menu on the top right and select (Dashboard).

Step 3 — find and select the (Names) Tab

Next you will need to navigate to the NAMES tab. This tab will show you all your owned names. There are helpful tags next to some Names showing if they are expired and need to be extended.

Desktop: You will easily see the name tab on the
Mobile: Scroll down and find the Names tab and select this tab

Step 4 — Open the Dropdown and Click (Extend)

Desktop: On Desktop, once you get to the Names page, you will see a button called (Manage). When you select this button, you will be presented with a drop down menu with a couple different actions. Simply click, (Extend), and run that transaction.

Mobile: If you are on a mobile device, you won’t see the word (Manage), you will be presented with an arrow for you to select. This arrow will create the drop down menu for you to select (Extend).

Step 5 — Completion: Leave us a Thought!

After the transaction is successful, your name will be extended and you can keep using the platform and enjoying all the amazing features on our webpage.

So take the time to leave us a comment via our on-chain “Thoughts” channel and browse the Marketplace.

Questions:

If you have any questions feel free to reach out to us on our Discord channel and one of our staff members will handle it in a timely manner!

Thanks for Reading!

Helpful Links:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all links below).

Website: https://find.xyz/lf/thoughts
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Emerald ID: https://id.ecdao.org/

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: Enjoy Flow NFTs, all in one place — .find links with Emerald DAO
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Enjoy Flow NFTs, all in one place — .find links with Emerald DAO

The .find platform has established a link with the Emerald DAO to provide more content to users of the .find platform.

Overview

When it comes to owning NFTs, viewing your entire collection is one of the many joys within the Web3 space. This was often time consuming and confusing on Flow Blockchain because collections were often spread out between different wallets and platforms. No longer is that the case now that .find has implemented a link with the Emerald City.

Now, users only have to complete two simple steps to have access to majority of the NFTs on Flow Blockchain.

View Lillico, Blocto, and Dapper NFTs all in one place.

.find Platform

The .find platform already allowed users the ability to sign-in and link their Blocto wallets to their profile, this new integration now opens the door to easily view both Dapper and Lillico NFTs as well as Blocto NFTs. Exciting times to view all your NFTs in one place.

This integration allows for viewing of your entire collection, but only Blocto NFTs can be traded. We are in the process of fully integrating the Dapper Wallet, allowing users the ability to trade Dapper NFTs so keep a look out for that announcement!

The Emerald ID

The Emerald ID is an impressive system built by the Emerald DAO team. It has been around for a couple months allowing users the ability to link certain Flow wallets to a distinct Discord handle.

By linking users wallets to their Discord handle, users are able to easily verify NFT ownership when bouncing between Discord servers.

Currently, the Emerald ID supports three different wallets: Lillico, Blocto, and Dapper wallets. If you have one or more of these wallets, you can link them to your Emerald ID and your .find profile will automatically update if you are a current .find user.

Easy Setup:

The integration is possible in two easy steps:

  • Step One: Create a .find profile here — www.find.xyz
  • Step Two: Create and link all your wallets to a Emerald DAO account here: https://id.ecdao.org/
  • Note: If you already have a .find profile and Emerald ID, then your account is already good-to-go! You can begin enjoying all your NFTs

No Discord?

Currently, the Emerald ID works by linking your wallets to a distinct Discord handle. Understanding not all users utilise Discord, .find is in the process of enabling our own wallet linkage system for users who don’t want the required Discord portion of Emerald ID. So stay tuned!

Conclusion

We at .find are constantly moving forward with empowering users and always open to collaborating with other builders. The ability to work with Emerald DAO on this collaborative piece has opened doors for new users to enjoy their Flow NFT collections.

So what are you waiting for? Go .find something new and don’t forget to tag us on social media! We want to see what you are looking at.

Helpful Links:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all links below).

Website: https://find.xyz/lf/thoughts
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow
Emerald ID: https://id.ecdao.org/

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: “Thoughts” — an On-Chain Messaging system built for Flow Blockchain
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
“Thoughts” — an On-Chain Messaging system built for Flow Blockchain

The ability to share ideas is one of the many characteristics that separates us from other mammals. We at .find are enabling users to permanently share their ideas and thoughts on the Flow Blockchain via our new Messaging platform.

The Big Idea:

We humans are social creatures, we enjoy sharing interesting thoughts, simple gestures, and wacky jokes with our friends and community members. These expressions showcase our fluctuating moods and unique characters. At .find, we want to allow users the ability to etch their ideas in a virtual stone wall.

As the famous line goes, “I think, therefore I am”.

An Online Persona

At .find, we strive to support our users in expressing their individuality through a myriad of ways. From custom profiles, to unique wallet names, to solidifying their “thoughts” on the Flow Blockchain; we strive to empower our users in all aspects of their digital identity.

And this is only the beginning. Our first iteration of this platform allows users to post permanent content to the “live-feed”, via one simple and fast transaction.

Version 1.0: “Thoughts Launch on .find”

With the current build, users can:

  • Post permanent “Thoughts” directly to the live-feed using a Blocto Wallet (subsidised gas fees via Blocto).
  • React to other user “Thoughts” using different emojis.

Our Roadmap for this Feature set:

With the first iteration built and live, our developers are quickly coming up with new ways to interact with this new feature.

Planned features for the “Thoughts” Platform:

  • Allow users to edit their posts
  • Delete “Thoughts”
  • Add images; link NFTs to their “Thoughts”
  • Reply to other .find users “Thoughts”
  • Send Direct Messages to other .find users
  • Mint their thoughts as actual NFTs

Conclusion:

This is merely the beginning of the road for this new communicative platform, and we look forward to working with users as we continually build our “Thoughts” platform. Each human is unique and their thoughts and ideas make them a valued member of our community.

So I leave you with this question: “What will your first thought be?”

Helpful Links:

You can stay updated and leave comments on our Roadmap, chat in our Discord channel, and follow us on Twitter (all links below).

Website: https://find.xyz/lf/thoughts
Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow
Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow

Author:

Erick White https://twitter.com/Erick_makes_Art

item.title: One Year Anniversary — Loads of New Features from the .Find Platform
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
Year One Anniversary — Feature Release — from the .Find Platform

Over the past year, .Find has been diligently designing and building exciting new features for our evolving platform on the Flow Blockchain. Codenamed operation Flamingo, this set of new features brings a lot of excitement and utility to .Find and Flow; this Post is an overview from the latest release on 13.12.22.

11 - New Features Overview:

  • Marketplace Tags
  • On-Chain “Thoughts” — v 1.0
  • Upgraded Livefeed
  • User Reactions and Watchlist
  • New On-boarding Process
  • Flowty Integration
  • NFT Storefront Integration
  • Website Visual Upgrades
  • Sending NFT Upgrades
  • The Furnace — Burn NFTs
  • Upgraded Visibility of Roadmap

Feature 1: Marketplace Tags:

Browsing your collection is one of the simple joys of owning NFTs and it’s also fun to browse other wallets as well. Sometimes we stumble across inspiring art pieces while browsing other collections and we have made it easier to see if it is For Sale or Auction.

We added indicators on the bottom left of NFTs quickly showing users which NFTs are listed on the marketplace and which one’s aren’t making browsing an even more enjoyable experience.

Feature 2: On-Chain “Thoughts” Posts V1

Thoughts, are an exciting feature arriving to our platform! These “Thoughts” are a fully on-chain, public messaging experience, allowing users the ability to write messages directly on the live-feed.

This is a truly exciting feature with more information to come! Look for its own Medium post soon.

Feature 3: Upgraded Livefeed

In a world that produces more data than any other resource, it can be quite overwhelming when trying to find what you are looking for, .Find wants to help with that dilemma.

Our custom Livefeed now offers users the ability to Filter their searches, narrowing down their searches to exactly what they are looking for.

Filter Options:

  • Latest Sales
  • Latest Listings
  • Mints
  • Thoughts
  • Burns
  • Trending (Coming Soon)

Feature 4: User Reactions and Watchlists!

This addition adds multiple ways to interact with our website and the NFTs being showcased. From building a custom favorites list, to counting views, and reacting to other thoughts, the interactive possibilities are here on .Find!

Favorites:

The favorites list is built using the (Heart) icon on-top of NFTs. Add a heart and that NFT is added to your Watch List, easy as that! This easy system allows you, the user, the ability to follow your favorite NFTs in the Flow Ecosystem!

  • Favorites List & Watchlist (Same thing)
This list if found under the user store-front page on our website! Get out there and start filling it up with your Favorite NFTs!

Likes:

These are stored with the NFT and separate from the favorites list. Sometimes we like an NFT but wouldn’t buy it, this is that feature! .

Views:

Every time a user views an item, the counter goes up — simple but an interesting statistic to see what the community is viewing.

Feature 5: New Onboarding Process — Profile Enhancements

User profiles are how we showcase ourselves to the world, it is one of the standing hallmarks of PFP projects, interesting usernames, and personification of ourselves in the digital world.

Here at .Find, we want to make that process easier and more enjoyable, so we updated our system to guide users through a new experience when setting up their profiles for the first time.

We have profile names, and .Find names, more clarification will come on the two soon.

Profile Names: On-chain but not tied to the user wallet.

.Find Names: On-chain resources giving users unique domain abilities within the Flow Ecosystem.

Feature 6 — Flowty Integration

Flowty is an interesting tool allowing users to create NFT Loans and Rentals on the Flow Blockchain. Need a Top Shot moment for a specific challenge or a Flovatar just for the weekend? We at .Find have made it easier to find what you are looking for with this integration.

Quickly see which NFTs are also listed on Flowty from the NFT Details Page.

Feature 7 : NFT Storefront Integration:

This feature shows NFTs are for sale using the NFT storefront contract from Flow. While your browsing other’s collections, you can now see who has items listed on outside marketplaces.

There are numerous sites out there using the NFT Storefront and we can’t show exactly which Storefront the NFT is listed on, yet, but we are working on that issue now!

Feature 8: Numerous Website Visual Upgrades

While browsing the website, you will notice numerous upgrades across the .Find site. These come together to make an overall more enjoyable user experience. These upgrades will continually be improved upon moving forward.

New Font: Inter

Mobile Experience Upgrades: New Mobile Models have been added for the mobile view, swipe away to close!

Feature 9: Sending NFTs? We made that easier also!

We added multiple new addition providing users more abilities and feedback when sending NFTs across the Flow Ecosystem.

  • Wallet information — Not all Flow NFTs are compatible with all wallets, users will now have more information concerning the receiver’s wallet allowing for more informed decisions.
  • Messages — You can now add messages to sent NFTs, allowing the sender to leave funny comments, congratulate giveaway winners, or simply say Enjoy!
  • New user “Inbox” Feature — Flow has a spam filter on wallets, rejecting NFTs from collections not established previously on the user’s wallet. This sometimes prevents the user from receiving NFTs they might want, so we implemented the Inbox.
  • Tip Jar — Saving a buck is always a plus, we added a tip jar when sending NFTs offering you, the user to tip the creators and platforms when sending NFTs. This is not mandatory but we wanted to empower users with the ability to continually support the communities they enjoy.
NFTs sent to wallets without the corresponding collection will go to that users Inbox until claimed, and they don’t want the NFT you sent, don’t claim it, simple as that!

Feature 10: The Furnace — Burn Baby Burn!

We all have one or two NFTs that are no longer needed in the collection, now you can burn those unwanted pieces via our Furnace.

  • This feature allows users to destroy unwanted NFTs
  • It also allows creators the ability to create interesting concepts with their projects, giving fun integrations between creator and collectors.
A development idea for creators: Burn one NFT and receive another, we are only scratching the surface on possibilities and believe this feature will come in handy in the years to come!

Feature 11: Upgraded Roadmap Visibility

Interested to know what we are currently working on? Or have some fun ideas on what we can add next to our platform, let us know!

  • On our Roadmap, you can see our tasks, report bug, leave comments, make suggestions, and keep updated all in one place.
  • Check it out here: https://roadmap.find.xyz/

Summary:

This massive feature release is just the tip of the iceberg for our plans with building out the .Find platform and the Flow Ecosystem. Our goal is to empower and connect users across Blockchains and with the Flow Ecosystem.

Collaboration:

At .Find, we are keen on collaborating with all projects currently building on Flow. From integrating our naming domain service, to being listed in our site, please reach out to us if you are interested in building out your platform for the greater good on Flow Blockchain.

Helpful Links:

Websites:

Find: https://find.xyz/

Flowty: https://www.flowty.io/

Flow Blockchain: https://flow.com/

Social Media:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/findonflow

Discord: https://discord.gg/findonflow

item.title: .find Artist Showcase —Lapin Mignon
item.dc:creator: .find (#onFlow) find.xyz
item.content:encoded:
The .find team would like to feature a special guest artist who is creating a small exquisite collection of Artwork for the .find platform.

Lapin Mignon has had an interesting career path, and has been in the NFT space since 2019, combining tangible pieces with digital accents. She has since created some beautiful art collections while building an engaged audience, with avid collectors, and the .find team is excited to be working with her on this collaborative piece.

Gender neutrality is an important topic, and we found our current automated PFPs were boxing people in, we want to change this. Lapin will be creating 4 different, gender neutral comical characters, in her unique style, specifically for .find.

Plus, the community will get to decide on the final characters that join the collection — so keep a look out!

Below you can see some example images on what those might look like!

Our Interview Questions:

How would you describe your art style? And when did you start focusing on art as more than a hobby?

I love describing my art as “Augmented Watercolour”. I am obsessed with using a large array of digital tools to enhance and augment my analog watercolour. The base artwork and the final artwork are miles away from each other. Augmented Reality, Dynamic NFT, Generative Art, Animation — Name it and I’ll deep dive into it with my paintings.

So have you always been an artist?

Well, art has always been a big part of my life, but ever since 2019, I found my audience and Art family in cryptoArt. This passion motivates me to create more, and I love seeing the support from the community.

Then in 2021, my work-life balance started to become a challenge, especially with 2 young energetic boys. So in March 2022, I decided to make the jump to go mainly into NFTs, Cryptocurrencies, and NFT Advisory, while remaining an Art Advisor for Fanny Lakoubay in LAL Art.

So you did first found CryptoART in 2019?

Yeah! I discovered CryptoART in 2019, in May to be precise; I was at a point in my life where Art was a hobby, but I wasn’t finding my audience. I was exhibiting my watercolours locally, but had a fear of falling into the crafts niche segment, and not being taken serious for my artwork, my creations weren’t crafts, they are art.

Often, during holiday season, I was questioning my career as an established Marketing Executive, but was dreaming to one day break through with my Art. Often considering returning to Art School, having left 15 years ago to attend Business School…

Okay, so you wanted to make Art a full-time gig, but struggling to break through, what was the big change?

Looking for other options, I texted a dear friend, Fanny Lakoubay for advice, as she did remote classes about Art. She replied with a link and a supportive message. “Try Editional App, and have fun with the community”. That was game changing for me. She briefly explained that instead of posting my artwork simply on social media, I could protect it by minting it on the Blockchain.

Back then, we were a small bunch of artists, most of us wondering what was happening, and we were minting and exchanging Art for free on the ETH blockchain (How crazy is that!). The rest is since History.

Okay, let’s circle back around to your art creation because you have a rather distinct style of mixing tangible drawings with digital media. Why is that?

Yeah! Since a very young age, I love crafting with everything around me. From the nature to paints, including rocks, leaves, clay, sand, shells, paper cuts, wool, wood, etc… My friends say I’m like Lavoisier, “ Nothing is lost, nothing is created, everything is transformed” and ever since I keep on creating from bits and pieces.

So the relationship with materiality, feel the paper, the water, is essential for me. I tried many times to draw on my tablet, with special pens, special textured screen — and I never felt any connection with it — I can draw, but the emotion of creating is not there, and as a kid, I need to enjoy the moment.

Woah that is really great to hear, I feel we are losing some of artistic styles as the world moves to a more digital setting. I’m happy you are keeping these mediums alive!

Also, I am a strong believer that computers and software tend to frame and influence how we work, as an Executive, I would take breaks from the laptop when I needed to be creative. To me, creativity comes alive with pen and paper. I have hundreds of notebooks, filled with creative ideas that might never have existed if I stayed in front of a digital screen.

Sounds logical but I can assure you that very few in the office space takes enough break from screens — and let’s think about it — Ideating around a powerpoint will force you to create a bullet point list or a diagram — here we are Formatisation; and it is just an example.

I have to agree, we do so much of our work with a screen, I feel it takes away some of the experience of creation as the computer fills in some of the dots. I recently picked up a sketch book again after drawing solely with Procreate over the last year. What do you enjoy using?

So I always start on paper, using a very thick 300g/m2 source from Canson, made for watercolours. Then I simply start drawing, sometimes I’ll mentally create a theme before drawing, and sometimes I dive in without a clear idea — just creating. Letting that uncontainable urge to hit the paper, to me feeling is essential, and I become a drawing machine letting my mind wander around the ink.

So my process is sketches with pencil, line art with pens, and then finally waatercolours.

So you created a tangible piece of art, but you like to add more digital aspects correct?

Correct, that is the base, the Analogue Art, which for most traditional artists or illustrators would be enough… But as mentioned I am obsessed on how to augment it, so begins the process of scanning, having created a montage on my desk to create a good quality scans, then using a a multitude of digital tools like Polarr to play with the colours, and Procreate to finalise details, animate, etc.

That is really exciting stuff! You enjoy collaboration as well, and moving toward Digital AI?

And I usually play with platforms once I minted it, as an NFT, like AsyncArt where I play with the Dynamic Aspect for my NFT with a Night and Day version of the same cryptoArt! and since I am now working a lot with Tagachi (who is this? Link to their work), ideas are flourishing.

Let’s move toward your collaboration with .find, how did you two meet? Since we are built on Flow and you are primarily on Ethereum.

They found me — Werekitty (discord handle) is one of my most supportive collectors — and I am forever grateful to her as she has supported my Art from the beginning. Collectors like that are so precious.

Then in 2022, I made a talk at NFC Lisbon about CryptoArt History and finally met Bjartek. That was quite emotional. I wish to one day meet his wife, (Werekitty). At that time, there was no mention of .find and in August, and I had to postpone further the launch of Mignonverse, another project of mine, because of the Bear Market. So I sent a tweet asking if anyone wanted to have an advisor for their project or platform, so that I had a little bit more time for the next few months. And Christian and Bjartek contacted me and I was in love with the idea of .find — here I am!

And we are happy to have you here Lapin! Thank you for sharing your amazing story with us and I’m excited to see where this collaboration goes as we move forward. Also, I’m interested to see the options people will have to vote on for the PFP images you are creating specifically for .find!

Find Website: https://find.xyz/
Lapin Mignon Website: https://www.lapinmignon.co.uk/
